meanings.definition: Talked in a noisy, excited, or declamatory manner.
meanings.sent1: The children clavered loudly during recess.
meanings.sent2: The politician clavered on stage, trying to win over the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The parrot clavered in the pet store, mimicking the sounds around it.
meanings.sent4: The thunder clavered through the night, waking up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The excited fans clavered with joy as their team won the championship.

meanings.definition: Engaged in idle or inconsequential talk.
meanings.sent1: She grew tired of the clavered gossip at the office.
meanings.sent2: The clavered chatter in the cafeteria was distracting.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked unimpressed by the clavered meows of the kittens.
meanings.sent4: The clavered banter among the students filled the classroom with noise.
meanings.sent5: The clavered discussions at the party lacked substance and depth.
